title: Deprecated lint triggering without line number (when using rustc_deprecated in libcore)

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

body:
I'm getting the following confusing error while trying to write a deprecation PR:
```rust
   Compiling core v0.0.0 (file:///C:/src/rust/src/libcore)
error: use of deprecated item: replaced by `iter::StepBy`
  |
  = note: #[deny(deprecated)] implied by #[deny(warnings)]
note: lint level defined here
 --> src\libcore\lib.rs:68:9
  |
68| #![deny(warnings)]
  |         ^^^^^^^^

error: use of deprecated item: replaced by `iter::StepBy`
  |
  = note: #[deny(deprecated)] implied by #[deny(warnings)]

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

error: Could not compile `core`.
```

repro: update /src/libcore/iter/range.rs to deprecate StepBy (I was on commit 920c4799bead614c21b12ba396afe19cb70730f3):
```rust
#[rustc_deprecated(since = "1.19.0",
                   reason = "replaced by `iter::StepBy`")]
pub struct StepBy<A, R> {
```

expected: something like the very-useful normal errors:
```rust
error: use of deprecated item: replaced by `iter::StepBy`
   --> src\libcore\iter\range.rs:280:36
    |
280 |     pub fn step_by(self, by: A) -> StepBy<A, Self> {
    |                                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
    |
    = note: #[deny(deprecated)] implied by #[deny(warnings)]
```

Looks like this is caused by the declaration of the deprecated struct -- *both* empty errors are resolved by `#[allow(deprecated)]` on the `pub struct`.  (This took quite a bit of guessing to figure out.)
